comments.body: wouldn't these usually go in a base.py or something?  I guess if you need them for the fixtures you could import them from there?

`base.py` semantically has generally been used for importing into other test classes.  I'm not sure I see the need to separate out all of configuration so to speak.

The fixtures in `conftest.py` will expose them appropriately once all test classes have been converted as `c_parser_only` has.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +5,9 @@

class BaseParser(object):
    engine = None
    low_memory = True
